subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format
msgSnippet: Easiest way to do it is use the JUnit tasks ( and ) in Ant, which will automatically output results in XML format if you tell them to.  Then

Easiest way to do it is use the JUnit tasks (<junit> and <batchtest>) in
Ant, which will automatically output results in XML format if you tell
them to.  Then use <junitreport> to automatically transform the XML into
a nice framed HTML report.

Scott Stirling

> Hi All,
> 
> We have an Autotest suit using Junit in my project. We were 
> generating .txt files to record all the test results. I want to use 
> XML for recording all the autotest results. Please advice me on how 
> to go about this.
